result.execSummary:
The defendant Roger G. Randle Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 30 days to pay or CV Judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roger G. Randle Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Amended
$914.50  Failure to pay, civil judgment.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney W Michel II.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State files amended information.  Atty Michel acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  Court imposes $300 fine plus costs, 30 DTP or civil judgment.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney W Michel II.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Michel states he gave proposal to ADA McNeill that she needs time to approve w/DA Zapf.  FPT continued to 1:45pm today.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney W Michel II.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Michel states he believes the case will be resolved.  FPT continued to 2/11/15 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney W Michel II.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Michel states they are close to a resolution.  FPT continued to 1/21/15 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
Final pre-trial on December 10, 2014 at 10:00 am.
NO RECORD. Matter adjourned, DE provided notice in court.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 10, 2014 at 10:00 am.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney W Michel II.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  DA PTC 9/19/14 at 1:30pm and FPT 10/7/14 at 3:45am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty William Michel.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Michel recently appointed.  D.A. Pretrial 8/15/14 at 1:30.  Judicial pretrial 9/17/14 at 8:45.  Bond continued.
William Michel  kmk

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney F Parise.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Parise moves to withdraw as counsel.  Court allows Atty Parise to withdraw.  STC set for 8/5/14 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Assistant District Attorney Zachary Wittchow, special prosecutor, appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney F Parise.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Parise acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft enters not guilty plea.  DA PTC 6/20/14 at 1:30pm and FPT 7/15/14 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

114pm
  Attorney Patrick Anderson appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Frank Parise.  Clerk LE.  Referred to Br 6 for further dispo on 6/18/14 @ 8:15 AM Argn.  Info Filed.  Bond Continued.
Waiver of Right to Prlim Hrg.
Arraignment on June 18, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court without counsel. Clerk LE. Case was scheduled for preliminary hearing this morning. Atty. Frank Parise is unable to appear due to illness. Case rescheduled for waiver of preliminary hearing on 5-21-14 @ 1:00pm. Bond continued.

120pm
  Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Frank Parise.  Clerk KZ  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Comm Mason on.5/20/14 @ 930am.  $1500  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).

*Not to possess or consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No drug paraphernalia
